bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Adrian Macia, November 6, 1940

div1.p: Hench describes the Lazear memorial event at Washington and Jefferson College. Hench is glad that the Camp Lazear site is owned by Macia, as Macia is a man who appreciates history.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Adrian Macia, November 6, 1940
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciated your kind
letter which you sent to me at Washington, Pennsylvania. The
Washington and Jefferson affair was a beautiful one, and every-
one was extremely interested in what I had to say. Relatives
of Dr. Lazear were there and they were delighted to hear that we
had found Camp Lazear and Building No. 1.

I shall await with interest further word from you
in the hopes that your partners will generously cooperate with
us also. It is indeed fortunate that this historical site is
owned by a man with such an appreciation for things of historical
and sentimental interest. I have something of a plan in mind
for the proper preservation, not only of the little building,
but also for the marking of Camp Lazear, and I will write you
a little later some of the details for your advice and approval.

I am leaving tomorrow for a little medical trip, but
I wanted to thank you, and I am enclosing a clipping which I
think will interest you.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
